contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport | Women's [[Water Polo]]}} {{MedalCountry | {{CAN}} }} {{MedalCompetition|[[World Aquatics Championships|World Championships]]}} {{MedalBronze| [[2001 World Aquatics Championships|2001 Fukuoka]] | Team}} {{MedalBronze|[[2005 World Aquatics Championships|2005 Montréal]]|[[Water Polo at the 2005 World Aquatics Championships|Team]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Pan American Games]]}} {{MedalSilver|[[2003 Pan American Games|2003 Santo Domingo]]|[[Water polo at the 2003 Pan American Games|Team]]}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Valérie Dionne''' (born July 29, 1980 in [[Sainte-Foy, Quebec]]) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[water polo]] player. She is a member of the national women's water polo team and has competed in five juvenile, 15 provincial, and 11 national championships. In 1999, the [[International Swimming Federation|FINA Cup]] team on which she played qualified for the [[2000 Summer Olympics]], where the team placed fifth in the final results. She was also part of the bronze medal-winning women's water polo team at the 2001 world championships in [[Fukuoka, Fukuoka|Fukuoka]], [[Japan]]. ==References== * [http://72.232.38.190/EN/athletes/query/details2.php?id=38478 Canadian Olympic Committee] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Dionne, Valerie | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian water polo player | DATE OF BIRTH = July 29, 1980 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dionne, Valerie}} [[Category:1980 births]] [[Category:Water polo players at the 2000 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Water polo players at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic water polo players of Canada]] [[Category:Canadian water polo players]] [[Category:French Quebecers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Sainte-Foy, Quebec]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Quebec]] [[Category:Canadian sportswomen]] {{Canada-waterpolo-bio-stub}}
